title: Apps for Tasks 2025-26
description: A one-page guide mapping common teaching tasks such as marking, quizzes and presentations to the best app for each job.

title: Google Classroom Assignment Codes
description: A printable reference sheet explaining the different assignment type codes used in Google Classroom and what each one means.

title: Learning Resource Hub Introduction
description: A tour of the school's central Learning Resource Hub, showing where to find shared teaching materials, databases and digital resources.

title: Gemini Revision Prompts
description: A curated collection of effective prompts you can use with Google Gemini to help students revise, generate practice questions and prepare for exams.

title: Customisation and Notifications
description: Personalise your Google Classroom with a theme, configure notification preferences and organise your class list for a smoother start to the year.

title: Classroom Sharing Link
description: Generate and share a direct link to your Google Classroom so colleagues can view your setup, resources and class structure.

title: Visiting a Classroom
description: Learn how to join and browse another teacher's Google Classroom to share ideas, observe their setup and find inspiration for your own classes.

title: Mark Work as Missing
description: Flag assignments as missing in Google Classroom and see at a glance which students have not yet submitted their work.

title: Google Classroom Weighted Marks
description: Set up category weighting in Google Classroom so that homework, classwork and exams each count for different percentages of the overall grade.

title: Google Classroom Comment Banks
description: Save and reuse common feedback phrases in Google Classroom so you can mark consistently without retyping the same comments.

title: Google Classroom Creating a Rubric
description: Build a marking rubric with criteria and achievement levels so students know exactly what is expected for each grade.

title: Google Classroom Using Rubrics Part 2
description: Import rubrics from other assignments, view rubric analytics and streamline your marking workflow with reusable assessment templates.

title: Marking Periods
description: Organise assignments into terms or half-terms in Google Classroom so grades are grouped by assessment window.

title: Marking Scales
description: Create custom grading scales such as A*-U, 1-9 or your own department system to match your assessment framework.

title: Checking for Plagiarism
description: Run plagiarism checks on student submissions using Google Classroom's built-in originality detection tool.

title: Pupils Checking Google Classroom Comments
description: Show students exactly where to find your comments and feedback on their submitted work in Google Classroom.

title: Google Classroom: Creating a Practice Set
description: Create auto-graded interactive question sets in Google Classroom that give students instant feedback as they practise.

title: Practice Sets: Assigning and Insights
description: Assign practice sets to your class and view detailed analytics on how students performed across each question.

title: Google Classroom: Automatically Updating Notability Documents
description: Link Notability assignments so that student changes sync automatically to Google Classroom without manual uploads.

title: NotebookLM and Google Classroom
description: Connect NotebookLM to your Google Classroom materials to create AI-powered revision aids, summaries and study guides.

title: Student Selector
description: Use the Student Selector feature in Google Classroom to randomly pick students for questions or tasks and keep everyone engaged.

title: Student Selector (Advanced)
description: Further tips on using the Student Selector including grouping options, history tracking and customising selection behaviour.

title: Google Slides Speaker Spotlight
description: Overlay your webcam feed on top of your Google Slides during a live presentation or recording for a more engaging delivery.

title: Timers in Slides
description: Embed a countdown timer directly into your Google Slides for timed tasks, quizzes and transition breaks.

title: Gmail: Settings and Customisation
description: Set up your Gmail signature, choose a layout, manage labels and tweak notification preferences for a cleaner inbox.

title: Email Filters
description: Set up Gmail filters to automatically sort, label and organise incoming emails so you never miss what is important.

title: Importing Pupil Birthdays
description: Bulk-import your form group's birthdays into Google Calendar so you never miss one during the year.

title: Appointment Schedule
description: Create bookable appointment slots in Google Calendar for parent evenings, student meetings or office hours.

title: Google Forms Updates
description: A rundown of new features in Google Forms including branching logic, quiz improvements, themes and response validation.

title: Google Updates
description: A roundup of the latest changes across Gmail, Docs, Slides, Classroom and other Google Workspace apps.

title: Gemini and Google Workspace
description: Use Google's built-in Gemini AI to draft emails, summarise documents, create slides and analyse spreadsheets directly within Workspace apps.

title: Gems
description: A collection of lesser-known tips and hidden features across Google Workspace apps that will save you time every day.

title: Visual Stories AI
description: Combine AI-generated images into visual narratives for creative writing prompts, presentations or classroom displays.

title: Scanning and Transcribing
description: Point your device at handwritten notes or printed text and get an editable digital transcript instantly using AI-powered recognition.

title: Comet AI
description: A quick look at Comet AI, an AI assistant designed specifically for education that helps with lesson planning and resource creation.

title: Brisk Pro Marking Example
description: Watch Brisk analyse and mark a piece of student work, generating detailed feedback with grades and improvement suggestions in seconds.

title: Brisk Activities
description: Use Brisk to auto-generate classroom activities like quizzes, discussions and worksheets from any topic or source material.

title: Brisk Teaching
description: See how Brisk fits into a typical lesson cycle, from planning through to delivering activities and giving feedback on student work.

title: Brisk Next
description: A look at the latest Brisk features including improved feedback tools, new activity types and expanded integrations.

title: Perplexity (Updated)
description: An updated walkthrough of Perplexity AI, the search engine that gives source-backed answers and is ideal for checking facts and exploring topics quickly.

title: Answering Exam Papers
description: Use AI to generate model answers and mark schemes for exam papers, helping you prepare students more efficiently.

title: Creating a New Notebook in NotebookLM (PDF Guide)
description: A step-by-step printed guide walking through how to create your first notebook in Google NotebookLM and add sources.

title: Notebook LM
description: Upload sources to Google NotebookLM and let it generate summaries, answer questions and create study materials from your documents.

title: NotebookLM Flashcards
description: Automatically generate revision flashcards from any document you upload to NotebookLM, perfect for student exam preparation.

title: Notebook LM Mind Maps
description: Turn your uploaded documents into visual mind maps in NotebookLM that show how key concepts connect.

title: Perplexity
description: An introduction to Perplexity AI, showing how this AI-powered search engine gives source-backed answers for research and fact-checking.

title: Perplexity Pages
description: Create and share polished research pages that combine your Perplexity findings into a readable, shareable format.

title: Deep Research Gemini
description: Ask Google Gemini to conduct extended research on a topic and receive a comprehensive, sourced report back.

title: Agent AI Example
description: See an AI agent complete a multi-step task automatically, demonstrating how agent-based AI can research topics and draft summaries.

title: Gamma and Quizizz
description: Create a polished AI-generated presentation with Gamma, then turn it into an interactive quiz with Quizizz for formative assessment.

title: Canva Code
description: Generate a shareable Canva code so students can duplicate your template and work on their own copy independently.

title: AI Image Editing
description: Use AI to remove backgrounds, extend images, fix quality and make edits without needing professional design software.

title: Cove
description: Use Cove to collaboratively brainstorm, plan and build resources with an AI-powered canvas interface.

title: Napkin AI
description: Paste any text and Napkin AI instantly turns it into clean diagrams, flowcharts and infographics for lessons and resources.

title: Create Questions on a YouTube Video
description: Generate a set of comprehension questions based on any YouTube video for classroom use, saving you time on resource creation.

title: Magic School - Text Questions
description: Paste any text and MagicSchool will create differentiated comprehension questions in seconds, ready for classroom use.

title: MagicSchool AI Export to Google Forms
description: Take your AI-generated questions from MagicSchool and export them straight into a Google Form for easy distribution and auto-marking.

title: MagicStudent
description: How the student-facing side of MagicSchool works, with built-in guardrails that guide learning rather than simply giving answers.

title: No AI
description: Visual reference card for the 'No AI' level of the AI Assessment Scale, where work must be entirely the student's own without any AI assistance.

title: AI Planning
description: Visual reference card for the 'AI Planning' level, where students may use AI for brainstorming and outlining only.

title: AI Collaboration
description: Visual reference card for the 'AI Collaboration' level, where students work alongside AI as a co-author or editor.

title: Full AI
description: Visual reference card for the 'Full AI' level, where students direct the AI to produce the output and then evaluate and refine it.

title: Teacher Version
description: The complete teacher reference showing all levels of the AI Assessment Scale from No AI to Full AI, with guidance on when to use each.

title: Pupil Version
description: The student-friendly version of the AI Assessment Scale, designed to be shared with classes when setting assignments that involve AI.

title: Screen Mirroring
description: Wirelessly display your Mac or iPad on the classroom screen using AirPlay or a direct connection for presentations and demos.

title: Issuing Replacement Wristbands
description: The step-by-step process for issuing a new access wristband when a student loses or damages theirs.

title: Apple Sidecar (Part 1)
description: Turn your iPad into a second monitor for your Mac using Apple Sidecar, great for keeping notes visible while presenting.

title: Apple Sidecar (Part 2)
description: Advanced Sidecar tips including gesture controls, app positioning and troubleshooting common connection issues.

title: Apple Notes - Transcript
description: Record audio in Apple Notes and get an automatic, searchable transcript alongside your recording for meetings and observations.

title: Canva Basics
description: Get started with Canva to create slides, posters, worksheets and social graphics using simple drag-and-drop tools.

title: Camera Set Up
description: Position and configure your webcam or document camera for clear recordings and video calls in your classroom.

title: Signing Out
description: How to properly sign out of your school Mac, Google account and apps at the end of the day to keep your data secure.

title: Bulk Print
description: Set up bulk print jobs from your Mac so you can print class sets of worksheets and handouts efficiently.

title: iSams Pupil Preferred Name
description: Look up and update a pupil's preferred name in iSams when it differs from their registered name.

title: iSams into Google Calendar
description: Import your iSams timetable into Google Calendar so all your lessons appear alongside meetings and events.

title: Viewing and Locking Screens
description: See every student's iPad screen in real time and lock devices with one tap when you need their attention.

title: Locking into an App
description: Force all students into a single app using Apple Classroom so they cannot switch away during a focused task.

title: Locking Groups of Students into an App
description: Send different groups of students to different apps at the same time for differentiated activities using Apple Classroom.

title: Creating an Agenda
description: Build a lesson agenda in Apple Classroom with links to apps, websites and files that students tap through in order.

title: Using Agendas in Lessons
description: Walk your class through a pre-built Apple Classroom agenda, moving everyone to the next activity together during the lesson.

title: Syncing Notability
description: Ensure Notability syncs properly between iPad and the cloud so students always have the latest version of their notes.

title: Backing Up Notability
description: Show students how to back up their Notability notebooks to iCloud or Google Drive to avoid losing important work.

title: Organising Documents
description: Set up subjects, dividers and folders in Notability so students can find their notes and resources quickly.

title: Using Templates for Notetaking
description: Create or import note templates in Notability such as lined paper, grids and Cornell notes for consistent student notetaking.

title: ClickView
description: Browse, assign and track educational videos from ClickView's curated library of curriculum-aligned content.

title: PressReader Set Up
description: Download the PressReader app, connect to the school's account and start browsing newspapers and magazines.

title: Credo Source
description: Search across trusted academic databases using Credo Source to find peer-reviewed sources for student research projects.

title: PressReader
description: Navigate the PressReader interface, bookmark publications and download issues for offline reading on any device.

title: PressReader Log In
description: How to log in with your Haileybury credentials for full access to thousands of newspapers and magazines on PressReader.

title: MacBook Keyboard Shortcuts
description: A printable cheat sheet of the most useful Mac keyboard shortcuts for copy, paste, screenshots, window management and more.

title: AI in Education Key Terms
description: A plain-English glossary covering LLMs, prompts, hallucinations, tokens and other essential AI terminology for educators.

title: The Educators' AI Guide 2026 eBook
description: A comprehensive eBook covering AI pedagogy, classroom tools, policy frameworks and case studies for educators looking to deepen their understanding.

title: Pupil Tech Tips 2
description: A printable handout of technology tips designed for students, covering useful shortcuts and tools for their devices.

title: Tech Tips 1
description: A printable handout of essential technology tips for students, covering key apps, shortcuts and good digital habits.
